body: Does using `http://localhost:5000` fix this one too?

Note, using mlflow server seemed to work for this, mlflow ui seemed not to accept --host parameter?

having said that, we're currently using notebook server proxy extension, so that mlflow ui is exposed through jupyter url like .../proxy/5000/ . No problems until now, no ports to handle on container, and we inherit jupyter auth.

(recent fix for mlflow ui relative url now allows this to work properly through proxy
https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/pull/1413 )

@rquintino @mateiz 
None of the above solutions worked for me. However, I realized the node/js build scripts were not present in the cloned repo, hence I installed them.
From the directory "/mlflow/mlflow/server/js", I call npm start, which gives me this error, any idea what could be wrong?
Error: Cannot find module '/mlflow/mlflow/server/js/node_modules/react-scripts/config/webpack.config.dev'

Ah, in general, the MLflow repo is not designed so that you can just run the server from source. You'd have to do `npm install` first and then `npm start` as described here: https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.rst#running-the-javascript-dev-server, but instead, I would recommend building a distributable Python wheel artifact (https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.rst#building-a-distributable-artifact) and running that in your Docker container.

@mateiz  So I followed the instructions in the first link and now I'm able to connect to the server and see the ui. I call `npm start` in mlflow/server/js directory in one shell and `mlflow ui` in the same directory in another shell.
However, the server is reading the logs from mlflow/mlruns/0 which has no logs. When I change the directory to mlflow/examples/ and call `mlflow ui` or from mlflow/examples/mlruns/0, it does not connect and fails.  Is there a workaround this?

Hi @kamalaVJ : Default store is `FileStore` located at `./mlruns`. You can instead, start `mlflow server` with `--backend-store-uri` pointed to a location on local or n/w drive to instantiate `FileStore` for metdata. Or you could one of the supported databases. `mlflow ui` also supports this option.

ref : https://mlflow.org/docs/latest/tracking.html#mlflow-tracking-servers

Hi @mparkhe , 
I have tried that too and I get the same error - 
Can't connect to ('127.0.0.1', 5000)
Running the mlflow server failed

I am trying to self host mlflow on local machine and not using azure databricks.
